result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Toddgrick James Shepherd

defendant.name: Shepherd, Toddgrick James
defendant.address: 6100 West Lisbon Avenue Apt #1, Milwaukee, WI 53210

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Toddgrick James Shepherd appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Toddgrick James Shepherd.  Attorney Careen Gordon appears in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Court took judicial notice of 15CF2634. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Arnold. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Toddgrick James Shepherd appeared by audio, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Toddgrick James Shepherd.  Prosecuting Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Shepherd is housed at Dodge; they are having technical issues and unable to activate video. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Toddgrick James Shepherd not in court, in custody in Dodge County.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Toddgrick James Shepherd.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defendant was produced but unable to stay on Zoom due to a scheduling conflict at Dodge Correctional. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:39 PM Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court by video, defendant Toddgrick James Shepherd not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was on standby. Mr Shepherd is housed at Dodge; Dodge didn't have video available for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Toddgrick James Shepherd not in court, defendant in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Toddgrick James Shepherd not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Toddgrick James Shepherd in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Toddgrick James Shepherd in custody.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Toddgrick James Shepherd appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
